name: Riad Noir d'Ivoire

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very beautiful riad, close to souks. Good service, very welcoming. Extremely clean with lovely hamman and pool. Owned and run by an English lady with French influence. Not able to get a taxi to door, but owners happy to arrange any transport required. Lovely breakfast.
reviews.title: Immaculate riad, close to souks

reviews.text: We attended a lovely wedding in Marrakech. The weeklong stay at Riad Noir d'Ivoire included well-planned excursions to the market for shopping and street dining, a camel trek, and a chance to explore Morocco's night life. A friendly guide was sent when needed, a courtesy cell phone was provided for each room for emergencies, and reliable taxis were arranged every step of the way. Although we couldn't speak Arabic or French, we got by as one of the drivers spoke a third language, Spanish. The entire staff was willing to bend over backwards to accommodate all requests. Everyone smiled and seemed to enjoy the role they played in extending hospitality. The design of the rooms was to DIE FOR! Much better than ANY hotel. The owner, Jill, was very much hands on with the guests and saw to our every need and desire. The manager, Damien, also enhanced our experience with friendly suggestions of how to best enjoy the city. Shout out to the staff that became part of our "family" during the stay: Aziz, Miriam, Butta, Muhammed, and all the others. Should we venture back to this side of the world, we will be sure to stay at the Riad Noir d'Ivoire and nowhere else!!!
reviews.title: Experience of a lifetime in absolute BEST location of Morocco!

reviews.text: What a truly fantastic place this is. We stayed in the Riad for a week in October to cellebrate my wife's 40th birthday. Our main worry was how our two year old would go down. He's very well behaved but some hotels and their guests can get a bit put out by such a young guest. I needn't have worried. The staff are as wonderful as the other reviews have already indicated and go above and beyond the call of duty to make you feel welcome. The rooms and the decor are fabulous: like something from a film. Many thanks once again to Jill & Damien he are such great hosts. Also to the rest of the staff and the chef who kept producing ever more wonderful meals for us all, especially on our last night. Thanks also to Steve for introducing me to the best Congnac in the world. Makes my XO taste like cheap Scotch.
reviews.title: Wonderful Riad

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Have just returned from a three night stay at Riad Noir D'Ivoire - a special celebration weekend for my wife's birthday. I can't praise the Noir D'Ivoire highly enough. The Riad is a wonderful oasis within the medina of Marrakech and is beautifully presented and smoothly run, with a fine attention to detail that makes an oustanding experience. Jill and her team were constantly on hand and helpful with local bookings and tips that enabled us to get the very most out of our short stay. Highly recommended, you won't be disappointed.
reviews.title: Outstanding service and attention to detail
Souk it and see
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at Riad Noir d'Ivoire for three nights at the start of November for our first wedding anniversary. I cannot praise the riad highly enough. It was simply fantastic.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We found Noir d'Ivoire to be everything that fellow Trip Advisers say about it. So instead of repeating the rave reviews (which are fully justified) I will just add three tips. 1. Wear good serviceable shoes - the Riad is right in the middle of the old town (medina). The nearest taxi location is 5 minutes walk and the main square (Djemaa el Fna) is a good 20-25 minutes walk. Taxis are next to useless within the medina so walking is your main option.
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 2. Try to keep a stock of 20Dhm (about £1.50/€2/$2.40) notes - handy for tips and taxis (outside the medina).
reviews.title: Every bit as wonderful as my first stay...
Jill and her team plus the decor at Riad noir d’ivorie have that "je ne sais quoi" making it that bit special
reviews.text: 3. Take the open top bus tour (Dhm130) from the Koutoubia Mosque stop near the main square to get an overview of Marrakech and particularly the very pleasant new town area.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Lastly we visited for 5 days and, with a day trip into the Atlas Mountains (arranged, as ever, by the hospitable Damion and Jill) we found this was just about right to see all of Marrakesh and surrounds.
reviews.title: Utterly Fabulous

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Oh, and don't stop anywhere else - this is the best.
reviews.title: Absolutely Fabulous!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We loved it here. The location was perfect, just ten minutes walk from the souks about 15 from the square and the riad was very accessible. The staff was also friendly and efficient, everything we asked for was arranged very fast. Our room was very nice, but a bit cold at night. I would be happy to recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Marrakech.
reviews.title: Excellent location

reviews.text: Dear Potential Riad Noir d'Ivoire Guest,
reviews.title: Marry-kech: The Ultimate Morrocan Destination Wedding Experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Due to the lack of wedding related posts on Marrakech, this is an account of my experience at Riad Noir d'Ivoire. Just to fully disclose, you must book the entire Riad in order to have a wedding here, otherwise read on..
reviews.title: The Most Beautiful Riad in Marrakech

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I can honestly say that all my wedding guests and I are suffering immeasurable withdrawals from the hospitality of Riad Noir d'Ivoire. When I close my eyes at work, it's the only place I want to escape to.
reviews.title: Wow - Exceptional Luxury and Calm

reviews.text: The moment you walk in, your enter a cocoon of serenity, elegance and luxury service and trust me, it's hard to check out of this exquisitely designed riad.
reviews.title: A superb haven in the middle of chaos

reviews.text: Everyone has written so eloquently that there's not much left to say. I would, however like to submit that Noir d'Ivoire was also excellent for kids. I just returned from a week at the Riad with my husband and 3 children (11, 9, and 7). Jill, Damien, and the entire staff treated them like an indulgent aunts and uncles. They tracked down a special pancake they had read and fantasized about, they hoisted our youngest up on donkey Cous-Cous's cart to his delight, they smilingly served up hot chocolates at any hour of the day. I had asked Jill for some suggestions for day trip out of the city, and she went above and beyond the call of duty by arranging the entire trip for us, including driver and accomodation. And what a trip it was: an unforgettable odyssey to the distant 20-story Saharan dunes to ride camels.
reviews.title: Great for families too

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In a daunting city to tackle with kids, Noir d'Ivoire made it a pleasure.
reviews.title: It's not Switzerland

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It seems that there is little to say about the Riad Noir d'Ivoire that has not already been captured by the host of happy reviewers justly singing its praises.
reviews.title: Gorgeous Refugium

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Located in the Medina, an 11th century maze seemingly designed by a master puzzle-maker intent on inducing near constant dis-orientation, the riad is in an area that seems somewhat less frequently traversed by European travelers as it is a 20 minute walk to the souks and Jemaa el Fna. The Medina is a mad, discordant and thoroughly untamed mess during the day with peoples of all backgrounds (Arabs, Berbers, Africans from further south on the continent, Europeans, etc) jostling to make their way through the narrow winding streets while trying hard not to get run down by seemingly insane scooter drivers apparently intent on killing innocent pedestrians and themselves. Late at night the streets and alleys are quiet and spooky, with soft yellow lighting, shadowy corners, and dark passages that can seem frightening at times. Arriving back at the riad, whether from the perils of the day or the mysteries of the night, is a transcendental experience that is not unlike waking from a fitful dream to find yourself sunk warmly into your own comfortable bed.
reviews.title: take refuge in absolute serenity

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Making your adventures in the Medina , the new city, or further afield easier and more enjoyable are Jill (the owner) and Damien (the GM). Together, working as a tag team of helpfulness, they managed to worm their way into the lives of this somewhat jaded and cynical couple in a matter of days. From strangers we were paying to accommodate us (and from whom we would typically need little more than concierge services), they rapidly became our friends and confidants. They seemed to have the amazing ability to sense who needed help, how much and when - like emergency room doctors performing expert triage - and quickly suggested and made arrangements that seemed to best suit the "adventure-level" of the guest in question, from door-to-door hand-holding to "take a left at the orange barrels".
reviews.title: Amazing Riad, Incredible Staff, Magical

description: Riad Noir d'Ivoire is a romantic destination composed of five suites, three of which have private roof terraces and jacuzzis, two junior suites and two double rooms. Services include Spa with traditional hammam, Boutique, fully equipped gym, library, restaurant and a heated pool. All suites have fireplaces and all rooms, have air conditioning, heating, mini-bars, hairdryers, wall safes and flat screen televisions. Meet and greet service with our donkey Couscous and our four loving cats!
